page.title: 03THE ACLE BY-PASS
page.content: ONE OF THE MAJOR TOPICS OF LOCAL CONVERSATION IS THE SITING OF THE A47 BY-PASS. AT THE MOMENT THE MAIN YARMOUTH TO NORWICH TRUNK ROAD PASSES RIGHT THROUGH THE CENTRE OF THE VILLAGE AND, CARRYING AS IT DOES A HUGE VOLUME OF CONTAINER TRAFFIC,AGRICULTURAL PLANT AND HOLIDAY TRAFFIC,LOCAL PEOPLE HAVE LONG BEEN LOBBYING FOR A BY-PASS ROAD. TWO ALTERNATIVE PLANS HAVE BEEN PUT FORWARD FOR CONSIDERATION: THE SOUTH ROUTE WOULD CUT ACROSS SOME CONSERVATIONALLY IMPORTANT MEADOW AND MARSHLAND AND DIVIDE ACLE FROM THE BORDERING COMMUNITY OF DAMGATE. THE SECOND OPTION,ROUTED TO THE NORTH OF THE D-BLOCK,WOULD PASS CHIEFLY THROUGH AGRICULTURAL LAND,BUT WOULD NECESSARILY BE SOMEWHAT LONGER. AT THE MOMENT (SUMMER 1985) IT APPEARS THAT THE FIRST OPTION HAS BEEN
